segment.source: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template
segment.target: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template

segment.source: You can use the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 8 to create your own driver tests or to customize some of the tests that are provided.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 8 to create your own driver tests or to customize some of the tests that are provided.

segment.source: You can deploy the tests that you create to remote test computers using the driver testing framework that the WDK provides for Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012.
segment.target: You can deploy the tests that you create to remote test computers using the driver testing framework that the WDK provides for Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012.

segment.source: The WDK provides templates that create starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script (JScript).
segment.target: The WDK provides templates that create starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script (JScript).

segment.source: You can select the test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.
segment.target: You can select the test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.

segment.source: You can customize the code to add new test cases for your driver.
segment.target: You can customize the code to add new test cases for your driver.

segment.source: You can deploy your tests from Visual Studio using the driver test framework.
segment.target: You can deploy your tests from Visual Studio using the driver test framework.

segment.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C++
segment.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C++

segment.source: From the File menu, click New Project.
segment.target: From the File menu, click New Project.

segment.source: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Visual C++ Windows Driver Tests.
segment.target: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Visual C++ Windows Driver Tests.

segment.source: Select Windows Driver Test in C++.
segment.target: Select Windows Driver Test in C++.

segment.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
segment.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

segment.source: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
segment.target: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

segment.source: For more information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.
segment.target: For more information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.

segment.source: Add the required test metadata.
segment.target: Add the required test metadata.

segment.source: For more information, see How to add test metadata.
segment.target: For more information, see How to add test metadata.

segment.source: Build your driver test.
segment.target: Build your driver test.

segment.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C\
segment.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for C\

segment.source: From the File menu, click New Project.
segment.target: From the File menu, click New Project.

segment.source: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Visual C\# Windows Driver .
segment.target: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Visual C\# Windows Driver .

segment.source: Select Windows Driver Test in C\#.
segment.target: Select Windows Driver Test in C\#.

segment.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
segment.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

segment.source: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
segment.target: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

segment.source: For information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.
segment.target: For information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.

segment.source: Add the required test metadata.
segment.target: Add the required test metadata.

segment.source: For more information, see How to add test metadata.
segment.target: For more information, see How to add test metadata.

segment.source: Build your driver test.
segment.target: Build your driver test.

segment.source: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for Script
segment.target: To customize a driver test using the Driver Test template for Script

segment.source: From the File menu, click New Project.
segment.target: From the File menu, click New Project.

segment.source: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Script Windows Driver .
segment.target: From the list of installed templates in the New Project dialog box, select Script Windows Driver .

segment.source: Select Windows Driver Test Script.
segment.target: Select Windows Driver Test Script.

segment.source: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).
segment.target: Provide a name for your driver test project and a location (or use the default).

segment.source: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.
segment.target: From the Windows Driver Test dialog box, select the test cases that you want to include or choose an empty (blank) driver test.

segment.source: For information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.
segment.target: For information about the test cases, see Windows Driver test cases.

segment.source: Add the required test metadata.
segment.target: Add the required test metadata.

segment.source: For more information, see How to add test metadata.
segment.target: For more information, see How to add test metadata.

segment.source: Build your driver test.
segment.target: Build your driver test.

segment.source: Making the driver tests you create available for deployment on test computers
segment.target: Making the driver tests you create available for deployment on test computers

segment.source: When you build your driver test, the new test will be available for deployment to a test computer.
segment.target: When you build your driver test, the new test will be available for deployment to a test computer.

segment.source: By default, the tests that you create will appear in the test category My Test Category.
segment.target: By default, the tests that you create will appear in the test category My Test Category.

segment.source: The names of the tests are based upon the test cases that you choose, and they will have names such as My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test.
segment.target: The names of the tests are based upon the test cases that you choose, and they will have names such as My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test.

segment.source: During each build of the test, the test will be overwritten.
segment.target: During each build of the test, the test will be overwritten.

segment.source: The latest build of the test will be available to deploy and run on the test computer.
segment.target: The latest build of the test will be available to deploy and run on the test computer.

segment.source: Windows Driver test cases
segment.target: Windows Driver test cases

segment.source: The WDK provides starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script.
segment.target: The WDK provides starter code for a Windows Driver test project in C++, C\#, and Script.

segment.source: You can select test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.
segment.target: You can select test cases that you want to include, or you can start with a blank project.

segment.source: Not all test cases are available in every language.
segment.target: Not all test cases are available in every language.

segment.source: Plug and Play Test Cases
segment.target: Plug and Play Test Cases

segment.source: Test cases that force a driver to handle most of the Plug and Play (PnP)-related IRPs
segment.target: Test cases that force a driver to handle most of the Plug and Play (PnP)-related IRPs

segment.source: Disable/Enable
segment.target: Disable/Enable

segment.source: Provides code for test cases that disable and enable a PnP device.
segment.target: Provides code for test cases that disable and enable a PnP device.

segment.source: Remove
segment.target: Remove

segment.source: Provides code for test cases that remove a PnP device.
segment.target: Provides code for test cases that remove a PnP device.

segment.source: Surprise Remove
segment.target: Surprise Remove

segment.source: Provides code for test cases that perform a surprise remove of a PnP device.
segment.target: Provides code for test cases that perform a surprise remove of a PnP device.

segment.source: Power Management Test Cases
segment.target: Power Management Test Cases

segment.source: Provides test cases that force a driver to handle system sleep states.
segment.target: Provides test cases that force a driver to handle system sleep states.

segment.source: System Sleep States
segment.target: System Sleep States

segment.source: Provides code for test cases that perform device I/O while the system cycles through sleep and power state.
segment.target: Provides code for test cases that perform device I/O while the system cycles through sleep and power state.

segment.source: Stress and Functionality Test Cases
segment.target: Stress and Functionality Test Cases

segment.source: Provides test cases that perform I/O stress and function testing of IOCTL and WMI interfaces.
segment.target: Provides test cases that perform I/O stress and function testing of IOCTL and WMI interfaces.

segment.source: I/O Stress
segment.target: I/O Stress

segment.source: Provides test cases that perform device I/O stress.
segment.target: Provides test cases that perform device I/O stress.

segment.source: Functional IOCTL Interface
segment.target: Functional IOCTL Interface

segment.source: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the IOCTL interface.
segment.target: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the IOCTL interface.

segment.source: (only available for C++ ).
segment.target: (only available for C++ ).

segment.source: Functional WMI Interface
segment.target: Functional WMI Interface

segment.source: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the Windows Management Interface (WMI).
segment.target: Provides a template for creating functional test cases for the Windows Management Interface (WMI).

segment.source: (only available in Script)
segment.target: (only available in Script)

segment.source: Empty Test Case
segment.target: Empty Test Case

segment.source: Provides a blank template for creating a Windows Driver test project.
segment.target: Provides a blank template for creating a Windows Driver test project.
